Field.name: Notes
Field.p: Count of the number of actively logged in sessions

Field.name: Notes
Field.p: Number of kb the host is dedicated for ballooning

Field.name: Notes
Field.p: Utilization of a port buffer (fabric, UCS specific)

Field.name: Notes
Field.p: Number of connections onto the application

Field.name: Notes
Field.p: For Physical machine - usage of CPU (current column). For VM - consumed CPU on the host (consumed column).

Field.name: Notes
Field.p: For VMs (consumed column) - VM buys from VDC or from desktop pool (VDI). For PMs - PMs sells to VDCs.

Field.name: Notes
Field.p: Number of VMs that can fit in all of the available CPU (on a cluster)

Field.name: Notes
Field.p: Capacity is based on the over-provisioned value in policy

Field.name: Notes
Field.p: The percentage of accesses that result in cache hits.

Field.name: Notes
Field.p: DB mem utilization or DM capacity

Field.name: Notes
Field.p: Amount of network traffic per second between two nodes

Field.name: Notes
Field.p: Amount of heap configured for an application

Field.p: For VDI, usage of the business user

Field.p: Amount of traffic through the IO adapter

Field.name: Notes
Field.p: Physical machine - usage of memory. VM - consumed memory.

Field.name: Notes
Field.p: VM - Sum of the Ready Queue usage of all of the CPU on the VM. To normalize the value, divide it by the number of vCPU. Host - Average of the underlying Ready Queue values from all of the corresponding VMs with the same number of vCPUs.
